content.text: How do we search for information that isn't written? Multimedia IR focuses on the retrieval of images, audio, and video by modeling their inherent features.
content.hook: Search for a song by humming, or a car by taking a photo.

content.text: Multimedia objects are stored as 'Feature Vectors'. We extract mathematical descriptors (colors, textures, audio frequencies) and represent them in a high-dimensional space.
content.hook: The Semantic Gap: The difference between raw pixels (computer view) and concepts like 'A happy dog' (human view).

content.text: Traditional keyword queries don't work for bitmaps. 1. Query by Example (QBE): Providing a sample image. 2. Query by Sketch: Drawing a shape. 3. Query by Humming: Measuring audio frequency shifts.
content.hook: Multimedia queries are visual and acoustic.

content.description: Imagine you want to find the name of a flower from a photo. Describe the 'Query Specification' process. How would the feature extraction look?

slides.title: Topic Quiz
questions: Why are feature vectors used for multimedia?
Name one trend in multimedia IR.

content.text: Trends include Deep Learning (CNNs), Generative AI search (Text-to-Image), and Multi-modal retrieval (Text+Image).
